meanings.definition: To remove a bruise or discoloration from
meanings.sent1: She gently debruised the apple to make it look fresh again.
meanings.sent2: The doctor debruised the patient's arm after the fall.
meanings.sent3: After a magical touch, the fairy debruised the flower petals.
meanings.sent4: His kind words debruised her wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: Using a special cream, she debruised the damaged skin.

meanings.definition: To heal or repair a bruise or injury
meanings.sent1: The medicine helped debruise the athlete's swollen ankle.
meanings.sent2: With time, the body naturally debruises itself after a bruise.
meanings.sent3: The healing potion debruised the knight's battle scars.
meanings.sent4: Laughter has the power to debruise a troubled mind.
meanings.sent5: Her warm hug seemed to debruise all his emotional wounds.
